abstract: New York State Comptroller Thomas P DiNapoli says that for fall 2014 election cycle, he will opt out of a public financing system for political campaigns that state lawmakers have just enacted; DiNapolic criticizes what he says is badly written, sloppy piece of legislation that was obviously rushed into effect, and expresses fears that it may actually have been designed to fail.
lead_paragraph: Thomas P. DiNapoli, New York State’s comptroller, says the system just enacted is a badly written, sloppy piece of legislation that was obviously rushed into effect.

headline.main: Comptroller to Opt Out of Public Financing System
headline.print_headline: Comptroller to Forgo Financing by Public
